cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a technique for specifying and refining features in software systems, which is a common concern in software engineering (cs.SE). The technique involves using state transition diagrams (STDs) as a graphic specification language, which is a topic related to programming languages (cs.PL). The paper also introduces refinement rules for STDs, which is a topic related to logic (cs.LO). Additionally, the paper discusses conflicting features, which is a topic related to formal methods (cs.FL) and system design (cs.SY).
